sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true relation of the conversion and baptism of Isuf the Turkish chaous, named Richard Christophilus In the presence of a full congregation, Jan. 30. 1658. in Covent-Garden, where Mr. Manton is minister. Imprimatur, Edm. Calamy. White, Thomas, 1628-1698. Dury, John, 1596-1680.
[30], 87, [1] p.
Printed by S. Griffin, and are to be sold by John Rothwell at the Fountain in Cheapside, and Thomas Vnderhill at the Bible in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1658 [i.e. 1659]
Author's note "To the reader" signed: Tho. White. "To the Christian reader" signed: John Durie. Numerous errors in pagination. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A true relation of the conversion and baptism of Isuf the Turkish chaous, named Richard Christophilus In the presence of a full congregation, Jan. 30. 1658. in Covent-Garden, where Mr. Manton is minister. Imprimatur, Edm. Calamy. White, Thomas, 1628-1698. Dury, John, 1596-1680.
[30], 87, [1] p.
Printed by S. Griffin, and are to be sold by John Rothwell at the Fountain in Cheapside, and Thomas Vnderhill at the Bible in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1658 [i.e. 1659]
Author's note "To the reader" signed: Tho. White. "To the Christian reader" signed: John Durie. Numerous errors in pagination. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
